alert.note: Alert for Yavapai County Mountains; Yavapai County Valleys and Basins (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 26 at 1:53PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact areas near Cherry and Prescott Valley in Yavapai County through 215 PM MST... At 151 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Cherry, or 11 miles east of Prescott Valley, moving west at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds of up to 40 mph, heavy rainfall, and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Prescott Valley, Dewey-humboldt, Yavapai County Fairgrounds, Cherry, Powell Springs Campground, Prescott Valley Event Center, Mingus Mountain Campground and Playground Group Campground. This includes the following highways... State Route 89 between mile markers 317 and 318. State Route 89A between mile markers 318 and 336. State Route 69 between mile markers 278 and 292. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to minor flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Yavapai County Mountains; Yavapai County Valleys and Basins
